https://hk.appledaily.com/local/20200421/UG7KUV7WRORAP44AHCVNSLBU34/

葵涌差館汽油彈案
警長涉自導自演被捕

葵青警區一名警長涉嫌策劃本月中葵涌警署外一宗汽油彈案，警方拘捕放置者，追查後懷疑有人透過中間人再自編自導案件，意圖造成社會輿論，嫁禍抗爭者，之後佯裝調查再破案。警方新界北總區重案組經深入追查，昨日在秀茂坪以涉嫌妨礙司法公正罪名將警長拘捕。消息稱，有人被捕後否認涉案，聲稱被誣衊，警方仍在調查涉案警長犯案動機，不排除有更多人被捕。

葵青警區一名警長涉嫌妨礙司法公正，今日被新界北總區重案組拘捕。事緣本月13日葵涌警署發生險遭投擲汽油彈案件，警方及時拘捕一名青年，制止爆炸案發生，警方期後接獲指控，指是有警務人員自編自導事件，安排有人於犯案後採取拘捕行動，雖然指控未必真確，但葵青警區為秉公辦理，主動作出調查，並將案件交由新界北總區處理。

消息指，揭發今次案中案，是由於葵青警區繼續就擬施放汽油彈案作出調查，與此同時，收到相關投訴，指有警務人員疑安排被捕人士投擲汽油彈，並在及時作出拘捕，雖然只是指控，但葵青警區管理層相當震怒，認為必須嚴肅處理，絕不姑息，案件交予新界北總區重案組調查後，今晚拘捕一名38歲警長，他目前仍被扣查。

https://hk.news.yahoo.com/%E8%91%B5%E9%9D%92%E8%AD%A6%E5%8D%80%E8%AD%A6%E9%95%B7%E6%B6%89%E5%A6%A8%E7%A4%99%E5%8F%B8%E6%B3%95%E5%85%AC%E6%AD%A3-%E4%BB%8A%E8%A2%AB%E6%96%B0%E7%95%8C%E5%8C%97%E7%B8%BD%E5%8D%80%E9%87%8D%E6%A1%88%E7%B5%84%E6%8B%98%E6%8D%95-152122388.html

多謝手足提醒

https://news.rthk.hk/rthk/en/component/k2/1521740-20200421.htm

Police officer arrested 'over petrol bomb plot'

A 38-year-old police officer has been arrested in the Sau Mau Ping area on suspicion of perverting the course of justice.

The case has been referred to the New Territories North Regional Crime Unit.

Media reports said the police are investigating if the arrested officer was involved in a case linked to suspected petrol bombs outside Kwai Chung Police Station.

In the April 13 incident, a suspect who allegedly carried the bombs was arrested.

Reports say the officer was in contact with the suspect before the incident.

The police said they attach great importance to the conduct of personnel and anyone who commits illegal acts will not be tolerated.

https://www.thestandard.com.hk/section-news/section/4/218364/Bail-for-sarge-in-petrol-bomb-plot


Bail for sarge in petrol bomb plot

A police sergeant was released on bail last night after his arrest for allegedly plotting to stage a petrol bomb attack at Kwai Chung police station this month.

The 38-year-old, who belongs to the special task force in Kwai Ching district, was arrested on Monday at his home at the Disciplined Services Quarters in Sau Mau Ping on suspicion of perverting the course of justice.

The case is being investigated by the New Territories North regional crime unit and no charges has been laid as of last night, but he has been suspended from duty.

The planned attack took place on April 13 when a 21-year-old man placed a bag on a table at a sitting-out area near Kwai Chung police station before he was intercepted by a team of officers led by the sergeant. Two petrol bombs were found inside the bag.

Several days later, police arrested a 20-year-old driver who was said to have driven the man to the police station after reviewing CCTV footage in the vicinity. The driver allegedly told police he was instructed by someone to take the 21-year-old there, but refused to disclose the identity of the person.

Investigators discovered that the driver had "unusual contact" with the sergeant and suspected the police officer was behind the planned attack and took action against him.

"Initial findings showed that he had communicated with the driver, and therefore we made the arrest," a police source said.

The police said that despite the allegations potentially being unfounded, they will not tolerate anyone who commits unlawful acts.

"The police force values the conduct of personnel of our officers," the police said in a statement.

"The force will not tolerate any officers who commit illegal acts, and will deal with them in a serious manner, including carrying out criminal investigation and disciplinary reviews."

In July 2018, four police officers were arrested for staging a sweeping operation on illegal gambling activities in Tsuen Wan in an attempt to improve their prospects for promotion or pay hikes.

The four were arrested for perverting the course of justice, alongside a 39-year-old man identified only as Chan, who was instructed to pose as a gambler.

All of them, except Chan, had been released on bail as of early this month.

https://www.scmp.com/news/hong-kong/law-and-crime/article/3082594/three-suspected-bombs-found-abandoned-school-site-hong

14kg of dangerous substances and improvised bomb found at abandoned school site in Hong Kong

Hong Kong police found 14kg of dangerous substances and an improvised bomb at an abandoned school in eastern Kowloon on Saturday, with a senior officer saying some of the chemicals appeared to be from the campus of Polytechnic University occupied by protesters last year.

The disused site on Choi Shek Road in Ngau Tau Kok had been used by officers in the past to carry out exercises, but none of those drills involved such materials, the police said.

葵涌差館汽油彈案
警長涉自導自演被捕

葵青警區一名警長涉嫌策劃本月中葵涌警署外一宗汽油彈案，警方拘捕放置者，追查後懷疑有人透過中間人再自編自導案件，意圖造成社會輿論，嫁禍抗爭者，之後佯裝調查再破案。警方新界北總區重案組經深入追查，昨日在秀茂坪以涉嫌妨礙司法公正罪名將警長拘捕。消息稱，有人被捕後否認涉案，聲稱被誣衊，警方仍在調查涉案警長犯案動機，不排除有更多人被捕。

https://www.scmp.com/news/hong-kong/law-and-crime/article/3082594/three-suspected-bombs-found-abandoned-school-site-hong

14kg of dangerous substances and improvised bomb found at abandoned school site in Hong Kong

Hong Kong police found 14kg of dangerous substances and an improvised bomb at an abandoned school in eastern Kowloon on Saturday, with a senior officer saying some of the chemicals appeared to be from the campus of Polytechnic University occupied by protesters last year.

The disused site on Choi Shek Road in Ngau Tau Kok had been used by officers in the past to carry out exercises, but none of those drills involved such materials, the police said.

https://news.rthk.hk/rthk/en/component/k2/1521740-20200421.htm

Police officer arrested 'over petrol bomb plot'

A 38-year-old police officer has been arrested in the Sau Mau Ping area on suspicion of perverting the course of justice.

The case has been referred to the New Territories North Regional Crime Unit.

Media reports said the police are investigating if the arrested officer was involved in a case linked to suspected petrol bombs outside Kwai Chung Police Station.

In the April 13 incident, a suspect who allegedly carried the bombs was arrested.

Reports say the officer was in contact with the suspect before the incident.

The police said they attach great importance to the conduct of personnel and anyone who commits illegal acts will not be tolerated.
